content:
That's a great plan! Reaching out to reputable dealers like Bob's Watches and Matthew Bain can be a good way to find a Seamaster 2913, as they often have a network of collectors and dealers that they work with. Setting up alerts on 1stdibs and Chrono24 can also help you stay informed about new listings that match your search criteria.

Posting a wanted ad on the Vintage Omega Collectors forum and the Omega Forums can also be a great way to connect with other collectors and enthusiasts who may have a lead on a Seamaster 2913. These communities are often passionate about vintage Omega watches and may be able to provide valuable insights or connections.

Remember to be patient and persistent in your search. Finding a rare watch like the Seamaster 2913 can take time, and it's important to be cautious when dealing with high-value transactions. Make sure to research any potential sellers thoroughly and inspect the watch carefully before making a purchase.

Additionally, you may also want to consider reaching out to other vintage watch dealers and collectors who specialize in Omega watches. You can also try searching on other online marketplaces and forums, such as eBay, Reddit's Watch Collectors community, and other specialized watch forums.

Good luck in your search, and I hope you're able to find the Seamaster 2913 that you're looking for!
